stimulusHtml:
Â© Werner Forman Archive / The Bridgeman Art Library

In the work shown, Micronesian artists likely carved an unadorned stylized body because
choicesHtml: it was regularly dressed with fresh flowers and other coverings
it needed to fit into a small chest reserved for sacred objects
it would be pierced later with metal to bring the deity to life
its sculptural form emphasizes the natural grain of the wood
